metadata.subject: English
metadata.source: National Curriculum 2014 + KS2 STA English Reading Test Framework 2016 (STA/15/7341/e)

skills.description: Understand the meaning of unfamiliar words encountered in simple texts by using the surrounding context, including pictures and sentence sense, to make a reasonable guess at what the word means.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, English KS1 Reading — Comprehension; DFE-00174-2013

skills.description: Find and report specific information or key facts from a short piece of fiction or non-fiction, identifying the part of the text where the answer is located.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, English KS1 Reading — Comprehension; DFE-00174-2013

skills.description: Retell the main events of a story or the key steps in a non-fiction text, placing them in the correct order and identifying the most important ideas.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, English KS1 Reading — Comprehension; DFE-00174-2013

skills.description: Use clues in the text — characters' words, actions and feelings — to work out something the author has not stated directly, and begin to explain the reasoning behind that interpretation.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, English KS1 Reading — Comprehension; DFE-00174-2013

skills.description: Predict what is likely to happen next in a story or sequence of events, drawing on what has already been read and on prior knowledge of similar texts and situations.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, English KS1 Reading — Comprehension; DFE-00174-2013

skills.description: Identify and discuss words and phrases that capture attention or create an effect, beginning to explain what makes them interesting, surprising or effective in the context of the text.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, English KS1 Reading — Comprehension; DFE-00174-2013

skills.description: Give or explain the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in the text, drawing on understanding of the surrounding passage, knowledge of similar words, and awareness of how context shapes word meaning.
skills.source_reference: KS2 English Reading Test Framework 2016, STA/15/7341/e — Content domain 2a

skills.skill_name: Retrieval of information and key details
skills.description: Retrieve and record specific information and key details from both fiction and non-fiction texts, locating relevant sections and selecting the precise evidence required to answer a question.
skills.source_reference: KS2 English Reading Test Framework 2016, STA/15/7341/e — Content domain 2b

skills.description: Identify and summarise the main ideas drawn from more than one paragraph, distinguishing between central ideas and supporting detail, and representing the overall meaning of an extended passage concisely.
skills.source_reference: KS2 English Reading Test Framework 2016, STA/15/7341/e — Content domain 2c

skills.description: Make inferences about characters, events, settings and authorial viewpoint that go beyond what is stated explicitly, and justify those inferences by citing evidence from the text.
skills.source_reference: KS2 English Reading Test Framework 2016, STA/15/7341/e — Content domain 2d

skills.skill_name: Prediction from stated and implied details
skills.description: Predict what might happen next or later in a text on the basis of information both explicitly stated and strongly implied, drawing on the internal logic of the narrative or argument.
skills.source_reference: KS2 English Reading Test Framework 2016, STA/15/7341/e — Content domain 2e

skills.skill_name: How content and structure contribute to meaning
skills.description: Identify and explain how information or narrative content is organised and sequenced, and how the relationships between different parts of a text — such as causes and effects, or problem and resolution — contribute to its overall meaning.
skills.source_reference: KS2 English Reading Test Framework 2016, STA/15/7341/e — Content domain 2f

skills.description: Identify and explain how the author's choice of specific words and phrases enhances or shapes meaning, considering the connotations, imagery and deliberate effects created by those linguistic choices.
skills.source_reference: KS2 English Reading Test Framework 2016, STA/15/7341/e — Content domain 2g

skills.description: Make comparisons between different characters, events, viewpoints or sections within a single text, identifying similarities and differences and explaining what these comparisons reveal about meaning or theme.
skills.source_reference: KS2 English Reading Test Framework 2016, STA/15/7341/e — Content domain 2h

skills.skill_name: Analysing vocabulary choices and their effects
skills.description: Analyse how authors select and deploy vocabulary for effect, examining connotation, register, etymology and ambiguity, and evaluating how these choices position the reader or shape the meaning of the text.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, English KS3 Reading — Comprehension; DFE-00174-2013

skills.skill_name: Evaluating and synthesising information across a text
skills.description: Retrieve, select and evaluate information and evidence from across extended and complex texts, synthesising material from different sections to construct a coherent and comprehensive response.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, English KS3 Reading — Comprehension; DFE-00174-2013

skills.description: Summarise and distil ideas and arguments from substantial and challenging texts, exercising critical judgement about which information is central to the author's purpose and which is peripheral.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, English KS3 Reading — Comprehension; DFE-00174-2013

skills.description: Make subtle, sustained inferences about implied meanings, attitudes and themes across a whole text, using layered textual evidence to support a considered interpretation rather than a single reading.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, English KS3 Reading — Comprehension; DFE-00174-2013

skills.description: Form and evaluate hypotheses about a text's development, themes and intentions, revising those hypotheses in light of subsequent reading and explaining how earlier predictions were confirmed, complicated or subverted.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, English KS3 Reading — Comprehension; DFE-00174-2013

skills.description: Analyse how authors structure and organise texts at macro and micro levels — including genre conventions, narrative or argumentative architecture, paragraph organisation and sentence-level choices — and evaluate the effect of those structural decisions on the reader.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, English KS3 Reading — Comprehension; DFE-00174-2013

skills.description: Critically evaluate the techniques and choices through which authors achieve their purposes, considering language, form, structure and perspective as interrelated elements of craft rather than isolated features.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, English KS3 Reading — Comprehension; DFE-00174-2013

skills.description: Compare and contrast the content, style, purpose and viewpoint of two or more texts on related themes, synthesising evidence from multiple sources to construct an evaluative response that goes beyond listing similarities and differences.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, English KS3 Reading — Comprehension; DFE-00174-2013
